page.title: 08BONEHILL
page.content: This is a residential area which has many appearances of a village. The houses tend to be rather larger than those in nearby estates and are all privately owned. People living in this area say it is a pleasant, quiet area to live in, and they tend to be older and retired. Although it lies close to the A5 the area is surprisingly quiet with little traffic noise carrying from the main road. The main problem in the Bonehill area, according to the residents is the lack of Amenities. Apart from a small village green on which stands a phone box and a post box there is nothing. Residents say they have to travel to Fazeley or Mile Oak for the nearest shops and even then you can't always get what you want.
